title: What is considered a good offer for an ESL teacher? - Quora
tags: Teaching English as a Foreign Language (TEFL)

response.answer_text: It truly depends on the country. For Korea, a standard opening offer for a brand new teacher is 2.1 million won ($1,770 USD) a month, with housing, insurance, and one-way flight reimbursement as part of the contract. Cost of living can vary depending on the city/area you’re in, but I’d say it’s comparable to living in a mid-tier city in the US, but with much better public transportation. However, if you’re experienced you can easily negotiate up. I’ve heard (and seen on job listings) that you can make much more in China, as there’s more demand and less teachers. Other countries (like Vietnam or Thailand) may appear to offer much less, but the cost of living is significantly lower so there isn’t that much of a difference. Also, if you are a certified teacher then you could land a job in an international school, which will give you the most benefits, vacation time, and the most comfortable wage. Good luck!
